meanings.definition: A small piece or strip of paper, plastic, or similar material attached to an object to identify it or give instructions.
meanings.sent1: I put a tag on my suitcase to find it easily at the airport.
meanings.sent2: The price tag on the shirt showed it was on sale.
meanings.sent3: The tag on the present said, 'Open me first!'
meanings.sent4: Her name tag at work made it easy for customers to know who she was.
meanings.sent5: The tag on the keychain had a cute little cat design.

meanings.definition: A game in which one player chases the others and tries to touch one of them, who then becomes the chaser.
meanings.sent1: Let's play tag during recess today!
meanings.sent2: In tag, you have to run fast to avoid getting caught.
meanings.sent3: During the tag game, Sarah tripped and fell, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Playing tag felt like a race against the wind.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter filled the playground as they played tag.

meanings.definition: To attach a tag or label to something.
meanings.sent1: I need to tag these boxes before they are shipped.
meanings.sent2: She likes to tag her plants with their names.
meanings.sent3: He decided to tag his belongings to keep them organized.
meanings.sent4: The artist would tag each painting with a unique symbol.
meanings.sent5: Remember to tag your luggage with your contact information.

meanings.definition: To touch someone in a game of tag.
meanings.sent1: I will try to tag you before you reach the safe zone.
meanings.sent2: She tagged him on the shoulder and ran away.
meanings.sent3: He sneezed right when she was about to tag him, causing a funny moment.
meanings.sent4: Tagging her opponent in the game felt like a victory.
meanings.sent5: The excitement of tagging someone in tag made her heart race.
